content: On October 19, 1995, the Atlanta Braves clinched the World Series title by defeating the Cleveland Indians in Game 6, marking the franchise's first championship since moving to Atlanta. Tom Glavine delivered a stellar performance, throwing eight shutout innings and leading the Braves to a 1-0 victory at Atlanta-Fulton County Stadium. Fred McGriff's solo home run in the fifth inning provided the only run needed, cementing the Braves' place in baseball history and ending a 38-year championship drought for the franchise.
